website_summaries.verdict: Trail frequenters have a lot to love in the Trail 2650 GTX. Indeed, the shoe’s resplendent comfort can woo in even the most skeptic of customers. It is also a remarkably lightweight hiking footgear that offers highly dependable water protection and arch support. That said, its narrowness might come as a big no-no for individuals with extra stout feet. Nonetheless, the Danner Trail 2650 GTX is a phenomenal piece whose qualities make it too irresistible a product to ignore.
pros: The Danner Trail 2650 GTX is immensely comfortable, according to virtually everyone who has tried it
A decent number of consumers are impressed with the incredible lightness of this high-quality hiking shoe
Based on several reports, the hiker’s arch support is super reliable
This Danner product is a relentlessly waterproof shoe, say a couple of buyers
Less than a handful of patrons claim that the Trail 2650 GTX is amazingly versatile
cons: Wide-footed adventurers are not happy with the shoe’s narrow confines
Even the supposed 2E – Wide variant still feels restrictive to them
An owner finds the Danner Trail 2650 GTX a bit too pricey

customer_reviews.title: Quick Delivery
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Danner's. After years of reading the reviews, I thought for the price and features, I'd take a chance and buy. I'm not disappointed comfortable right from the box and a 13 fits like a 13. Only disappointment is that in reading all the ads about this Portland, OR company making American shoes, these are made in Vietnam.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: From other reviewers, I anticipated the shoe being narrow in width so I ordered one half size larger from 10 1/2 to 11. The shoe was still too narrow, which is disappointing for me because I wanted to wear them. So, Danner knows the shoe is manufactured too narrow but yet they have not corrected this design flaw. The shoe is expensive but if they are made in the USA, I could live with that but they are made off-shore and not the USA.
customer_reviews.author: gary truszkowski

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: This is the last time I give Danner a chance. I’ve worn Danners for over 30 years and they are just not any good anymore. I’ve worn these shoes three times now. I had to take a break after the first wear because they hurt my feet around the ankles. Now there is a click in the left shoe every time I take a step and it drives me nuts!! Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Laughery

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: My feet have become more used to my patrol boots and I had a hard time finding tennis shoes that didn’t hurt my feet even with insoles. I purchased these which were the same brand as my patrol boots. They fit just like my patrol boots and love them. They seem durable and having a vibram sole I hope will last a long time. I will update later on wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Studio-Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sized very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear 8.5 wide in New Balance. I sized up to 9 wide to try this Danner. This shoe was still too narrow to get my foot in.
customer_reviews.author: Supertester

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good support with Gore-Tex protection.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable right out of the box. Arch area seems narrow but is very supportive. Gore-Tex makes them very water resistant but still breathable for comfort. Tread is not overly aggressive, but worked well on both dry and wet trails in southern CA, but not really good on dirt with a high clay content. Overall very pleased with these hikers!
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific lightweight and waterproof hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific hiking shoe: lightweight and waterproof. Danner quality. Better than Keen or Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: FrankT

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking and hiking
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I bought them in advance of a trip to Disneyland, and they worked great and will continue to do so for walking and hiking. I wear Danner work boots and they are more comfortable than anything else I’ve tried, so getting these for hiking and walking was a no-brainer. They offer comfort and support, and are light and firm enough to add a bit of spring to each step.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Benham

customer_reviews.title: My dad loves them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my dad for fathers day. They have become his daily shoe. He feels very comfortable and the grip isn't too much, but just right. Especially as the monsoon season is upon us. They are quite light for a hiking shoe and if they have that quality Danner build I have experienced in the past, they're going to last him a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Salcido

customer_reviews.title: Your feet well thank you
customer_reviews.text: An exceptionally constructed hiking shoe (not a boot) that fit perfectly and is as comfortable as any shoe I've ever owned. Well worth the price. I would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Gendron

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought these!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the wide version after reading reviews where some complained about narrowness. I usually order D shoes and these EE fit perfectly. Very well made, and I can vouch that the Gortex works. Walked 3 miles my first wear. Worm and comfortable. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy choice
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable shoe. Sturdy yet comfortable. Break in period is just a couple of days wearing them all day. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: alwaysgoingsomewhere

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and no break in period. Keep feet dry and seem pretty durable. I will be buying another pair in the future.
customer_reviews.author: andrew peters

customer_reviews.title: To big and chunky
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 size too large for me. They are also quite stiff and clunky. Look like. Lown shoes while wearing shorts. No needs for these to be so big and chunky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy shoe but tight even with Wide EE
customer_reviews.text: I like the way its built even though Danner is suppose to be an American company but the shoes are made in Vietnam. The shoe fits tight now but the features are good so far. Hopefully I can break them up and will post an update later.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse C

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for what it provides. A little tight in the toe area for a EE. A little pricey as well for what you get. Over all Great shoe. i am on my feet and in the water most of my days. Very Comfortable:)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Poe

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I needed water proof shoes, but something that looked like tennis or running shoes. And these did just that.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought x3 more pairs
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of days to break-in but now they're my favorite shoes. Recommend heading over to Danner on-line store where these shoes are selling 30% off the Amazon price. It was such a great deal and I love these shoes so much I bought x3 more pairs. I find it so hard to get good quality shoes that fit for the money, so when I find them (like once every 3-4 yrs) I just buy them up :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All around awesome trail shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This day hiker is tremendous on the trail! Incredible stability with excellent comfort. Hard to find in a trail shoe. The shoe seems to perform better the more you wear it. I’ve bought the same pair again in another color!
customer_reviews.author: BigD64

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Much too narrow. I wear a 13 ee danner work boot that has enough room to keep comfy even when my foot swells after a long work day. I got the same size thinking it would be a good fit. It feels a size or two too small in terms of width, and a size up would be too long. Not good for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a fan
customer_reviews.text: Comfort, fit, support and quality. Pleased to have them in my wardrobe.
customer_reviews.author: L.A. counsellor

customer_reviews.title: Made my feet hurt, under the laces on the top of my foot.
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the product is great, well-made! Did not fit my feet and made them hurt!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Feeling good
customer_reviews.text: Fits and feels perfect! I will use exclusively when not in dress shoes or tennis shoes. Looks great with Kuhl pants too.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for any terrain.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awesome! It’s not the shoes’ fault I have crazy shaped feet. The look. The materials. The feel. The build quality. These shoes are really nice. Just what I expected from Danner.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Favorite shoes and water proof! No break in period, did a couple miles on them right out the box with no adjustment time.
customer_reviews.author: Fredie

customer_reviews.title: width
customer_reviews.text: not as wide as other shoes,Danners ee is like a e size
customer_reviews.author: Darwyn Engesser

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Very well-made snugs the foot very good. I will buy another pair
customer_reviews.author: B Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe, fit was perfect and they broke in quickly. Very comfortable and the support is better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Blumenshine

customer_reviews.title: Very high-quality hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very high-quality hiking shoes, It was nothing I don’t like about these shoes
customer_reviews.author: Dick

customer_reviews.title: Misinformation about country of origin
customer_reviews.text: Website stated these were made in the USA, tag clearly stated “ MADE IN VIETNAM. Shoes did not come in original packaging Sent them back
customer_reviews.author: William VanBrocklin

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, but very pricey for what it is. The wide size is was not wide enough for me. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: this is my every day running around shoe. very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Mark Janowski

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Probably put about 100 miles on them now, and still super comfortable. Absolutely no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Light and great traction.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. Light and comfortable. Took it on an 8 mile hike right out of the box. Took about a mile to get it worn in and shoes seemed to get lighter with every step. Great purchase and bought another for my brother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I received these shoes a week ago. I ordered 10 wide. While the length was good with a little toe rub the width was still too narrow. So i put in a shoe stretcher. A couple of different types. Stretch length, stretch width and now the shoes fit just like a very comfortable glove. I am very happy i did not return them. They are light, grippy , and very comfortable. I didnt need to replace the insole they are that comfortable...
customer_reviews.author: cochise

customer_reviews.title: New favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box and onto the trail. Wore these shoes on a 20 mile trek and loved every step! I wear a 13 and have a hard time finding light shoes that have enough room in the toe box. These caused no discomfort on my toes. Amazing cushion on the soles but still all the feeling of control of my thinner salomons. These are my new favorite shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Chigginths

customer_reviews.title: Run narrow had to order men’s wide to get fit for a woman
customer_reviews.text: Had to return and order wide width . The run very narrow, especially for hiking socks and/or low orthotics
customer_reviews.author: Suzy S.

product_meta.title: Danner Men's Trail 2650 3" GTX Hiking Shoe Denim Blue
product_meta.description: With 2,650 miles, the Pacific Crest Trail provides a wide variety of terrain over its epic expanse. Whether you're out for the weekend, a few miles or are looking to get some serious mileage, the PCT has something for you. It's that need for versatility that inspired our Trail 2650. Built to move quickly and confidently through the terrain of your choosing, the Trail 2650 can easily fill the role of a lightweight hiker or trainer. Using a Trailguard TPU shank and an EXO Heel System, the Trail 2650 is both lightweight and provides stability on challenging grounds.
feature_bullets: Reinforced, External Heel Counter For Maximum Support
Trailguard Platform With Exposed Tpu Shank Offers Lightweight, Athletic Performance
Vibram 460 Outsole With Megagrip Technology Offers Superior Grip On Wet And Dry Surfaces"
